pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:0.5_0: The training rule on telling truthfully
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.10_0: Some said, “There’s no need to do work for the householders, nor to take messages for them.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.11_0: Let’s instead praise one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.12_0: ‘Such a monk has the first absorption, such a monk the second absorption, such a monk the third, such a monk the fourth; such a monk is a stream-enterer, such a monk a once-returner, such a non-returner, such a perfected one; such a monk has the three true insights, and such the six direct knowledges.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.13_0: they’ll think, ‘This is how they’ll think of us.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.14_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort and have no trouble getting almsfood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.15_0: Indeed, this is the better way, that we praise one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.16_0: Then those monks praised one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.17_0: “Such a monk has the first absorption, such a monk the six direct knowledges.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.18_0: And those people thought, “We’re fortunate that such monks have come to us for the rainy-season residence. Such monks as these, who are virtuous and of good character, have never before entered the rains residence with us.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.19_0: And they gave such food and drink to those monks that they did not even eat and drink themselves, or give to their parents, to their wives and children, to their slaves, servants, and workers, to their friends and companions, or to their relatives.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.20_0: And they gave such food and drink to those monks that they did not eat and drink themselves, or give to their parents, to their wives and children, to their slaves, servants, and workers, to their friends and companions, or to their relatives.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.21_0: In this way those monks became satisfied, with a good color, a bright face, and clear skin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.2_0: At that time a number of monks who were friends had entered the rainy-season residence at the bank of the river Vaggumudā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.3_0: Just then Vajjī was short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw, and it was not easy to get by on almsfood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.4_0: The monks considered the difficult circumstances, and they thought,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.4_1: How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.5_0: Some said, “We could do work for the householders.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.5_1: they’ll think, ‘This is how they’ll think of us.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.6_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort and have no trouble getting almsfood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.7_0: Some said, “There’s no need to do work for the householders.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.8_0: Let’s instead take messages for them, and they’ll give something in return.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.1.9_0: In this way we’ll be united and in harmony, and we’ll spend the rainy season in comfort and have no trouble getting almsfood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.10_0: I hope you’re united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.12_0: we’ve had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.13_0: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not; they know the right time to ask and the right time not to ask.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.14_0: When they know the right time, they ask about it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.15_0: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, not when it is unbeneficial,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.16_0: for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.17_0: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.18_0: And the Buddha said to those monks, “In what way, monks, did you had a comfortable rains residence, without having any trouble getting almsfood?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.1_0: But now I’ve completed the rainy-season residence to go to see the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.20_0: “I hope you have come to be?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.23_0: “Monks, how can you for the sake of your stomachs praise one another’s superhuman qualities to householders?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.24_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.25_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.26.1_0: ‘If a monk truthfully tells a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.2_0: So when they had competed the rains residence and the three months had elapsed, those monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and left for Vesālī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.3_0: When they eventually arrived at Vesālī, they went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.4_0: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.5_0: At that time the monks who had completed the rains residence in that region were thin, haggard and pale, their veins protruding all over their limbs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.6_0: On the bank of the river Vaggumudā, color, a bright, and clear skin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.7_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks, it is the newly arrived monks of the Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.8_0: And the Buddha said to those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:1.2.9_0: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.41_2: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.43_0: if a monk says to a person who is not fully ordained, “The monk who made use of your robe ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.44_0: who made use of your almsfood ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.45_0: who made use of your dwelling ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.46_0: who made use of your medicines attained the fourth absorption in an empty dwelling ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.46_1: he attained the fourth absorption in an empty dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.46_2: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.48_0: who has made use of your dwelling ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.49_0: who has made use of your robe ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.4_0: if a monk says to a person who is not fully ordained, “The monk who stayed in your dwelling attained the second absorption ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.50_0: who has made use of your almsfood ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.51_0: who has made use of your furniture ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.52_0: who has made use of your medicines attained the fourth absorption in an empty dwelling ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.52_1: he attained the fourth absorption in an empty dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.52_2: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.54_0: if a monk says to a person who is not fully ordained, “The monk to whom you gave a dwelling ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.55_0: to whom you gave a robe ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.59_1: he attained the fourth absorption in an empty dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.59_2: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.6_0: the fourth absorption ... is attaining ... has attained ... obtains ... masters ... has realized the fourth absorption.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.6_1: He stayed in the fourth absorption,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.6_2: ... has realized the fourth absorption,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.5.8_0: if a monk says to a person who is not fully ordained, “The monk who stayed in your dwelling attained the emptiness release ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.6.2_0: if he truthfully tells one who is fully ordained;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc8:2.6.4_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on telling truthfully, is finished.
